This month, we're shaking things up with an exciting line-up of lightning talks presented by you, our vibrant community
members! This is your chance to share your knowledge, showcase your projects, and discuss your favourite R topics in a
quick, 5-10 minute format.

If you have a fascinating R project you're working on, a useful package you can't live without, or a data analysis
technique you think others should know about [sign up](https://forms.gle/YSWXarhwUpXZQp2J6) to present a lightning talk
and share it with the SheffieldR community!

Whether you're a seasoned R user or just starting out, we encourage everyone to participate. This is a fantastic
opportunity to learn from each other, exchange ideas, and inspire fellow R enthusiasts.

![Lightning Talks](image.png "Lightning Talks")

How to Participate:

- Register Your Topic: Fill out [this form](https://forms.gle/YSWXarhwUpXZQp2J6) to register your lightning talk topic.

- Prepare Your Talk: Visual aids are welcome but not required.

- Engage and Enjoy: Join us on the day, share your insights, and enjoy learning from others.

After the event, join us for drinks at the [The University Arms pub](https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/178278884), it's
a great opportunity to continue the conversation, network, and relax with fellow R enthusiasts.

Meeting is on Friday 21st of June at 4:00-5:30 in Seminar Room DB07 (42) [Bartolome
House](https://www.openstreetmap.org/relation/16555061), Broomhall, Sheffield S3 7RH

Sign up [here](https://www.meetup.com/sheffieldr-sheffield-r-users-group/events/301279273/).

Remote attendance is possible using [Google Meet](http://meet.google.com/gwr-anoz-mas).

If you have any questions or inquiries please email us [sheffieldr\@sheffield.ac.uk](mailto:sheffieldr@sheffield.ac.uk).

<!--more-->

## Topics Covered

A few links to material from some of the talks given...

- [rplaywright - Erika Siregar](https://github.com/erikaris/rplaywright) - Erika has developed a wrapper for the
  [playwright](https://playwright.dev/) testing framework and is keen to receive feedback from those who are able to
  test it.
- [Detecting Changes in Population Trends - Emma
  Pritchard](https://github.com/EmmaPritchard/Detecting_changes_population_trends)

- [Sophie Lee](https://github.com/sophie-a-lee) talked about using Quarto to create accessible, engaging teaching material.
- [BITSurv R Package for survival analysis - Ben](https://github.com/Ben-L-Stats/BITsurv)
- [Render R Markdown with GitHub Actions - Simon Rolph](https://github.com/simonrolph/render-rmarkdown-with-actions)
- [No Data, No Worries : Fabricatr](https://blog.nshephard.dev/sheffieldr-fabricatr-20240621/)

Erika Siregar also floated the idea of establishing a local Sheffield [R Ladies](https://rladies.org/) chapter so if
anyone is keen and would like to be involved in that please reach out and contact [Erika
directly](emsiregar1@sheffield.ac.uk).
